intro: Acriopsis javanica var. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate acris, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features compound leaves with serrated margins and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
